Mood_1.Phrase_1: Did you just move in? You've probably noticed my house down the street. It's the big one.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Yep, got 5 million dollars worth of solid gold countertops installed last week.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Coffee or tea?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Have you seen the sugar dispenser? People keep misplacing it.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hello there, dearie. I haven't seen you around before. Have you come to see the pigeons, too?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: That one always looks at me like it has something to say. But it's too shy to speak up!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Fifteen years with the city, you'd a man would know how to change a lightbulb.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Damn thing won't light up.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Bururu.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Cooo

Mood_1.Phrase_1: I can't stay awake unless my blood is at least eight percent caffeine.
Mood_1.Phrase_2:
Some people think that energy drinks are the way of the future. 
Not me, I'm a traditionalist.

Mood_1.Phrase_1:
What are you doing here? 
Look, you never saw this. 
Giddout and keep quiet 
and we won't have to break your legs.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Go on, shoo!

Mood_1.Phrase_1:
Welcome to our fine legitimate business establishment. 
Come on in and browse our selection of innocuous goods.
Mood_1.Phrase_2:
Toothbrushes, 
heating pads, 
motor oil, 
parachutes... 
If it's legal, we've got it!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey there. Got a quarter?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Could use a bite to eat.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Welcome to the neighborhood.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I'm sorry, I'm a bit preoccupied at the moment.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: 'Sup? You new around here? Don't you worry 'bout a thing, Joe here's got your back.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Joe Cool. G.I. Joe. Joe the Bro. Cuppa Joe. ... .... Average Joe.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey there. Mae's not looking this way, is she?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Mae's muffins are always dry and greasy. It sounds like an impossible combination, but some people are masters in the art of disgusting cuisine.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Good morning! I'm vascularizing my extensors. Care to join me?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: You know you're doing it right when you need someone else to untangle you.

Mood_1.Phrase_1:
Good morning. Are you new here? 
I'm busy at the moment, but come tell me your story sometime, ok?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I've been cobbling together this novel for many years now, but I can't quite make it stick...

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Ten bucks for a hot dog, whaddaya say?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: (...the scent is rather unappetizing)

Mood_1.Phrase_1:
Hi! 
I think we gave Dad a few more gray hairs back there. High five!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Hey, I'll show you something cool if you get me some candy!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Want to try your hand at a little game?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: No pressure, we keep it casual. But of course, if you lose, you are going to have to pay up.

Mood_1.Phrase_1:
Mornin'! 
Nothing for you today, sorry.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: It feels sometimes like this route never ends.

Mood_1.Phrase_1:
Welcome to town. 
Keep out of trouble 
and we'll be good as gravy, 
you hear?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I've got my eye on you.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Bao!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: *Lick*

Mood_1.Phrase_1:
I'm writing my thesis on the Alcubierre drive. 
By contracting space in front of your spaceship 
and expanding it behind, you could theoretically 
travel faster than light. 
Real-life warp!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I'm going to visit Betelgeuse someday.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: It's funny - once you get to be this rich, everyone gives you things for free.
Good morning, sir! Triple espresso with golf flakes again?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: So, uh, how about a raise, maybe...?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Augustus, dearie, how are you today?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Why, I remember when you were just a young lad. You were so cute, encouraging the neighborhood kids to make smart investments.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Not to worry, sir, got everything under control here.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: No sir, I never lollygag. I'm just… problem solving here.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: CooCoo
Mood_1.Phrase_2: (poop)

Mood_1.Phrase_1: I think she's got your coffee ready, I saw her making it before you came in.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Did you get that coffee? If not, I might go grab it.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Augustus! How are you today?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Made any interesting 'investments' lately?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: No Sir.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Yes Sir.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hello, Sir. I've got your lunch all prepared if you'd like to go inside.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: No, your shoes will be shined by the end of the day, not to worry.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: I'm looking for a new job, but I don't think I'll make it through the interview if I'm dressed like this.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Ever played frisbee before?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: I've heard rumors that the store around the corner is selling solid gold muffin tins. Have you heard anything about that?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Bet those muffins would taste delicious.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Don't look at me like that. I have a right to do yoga in the park. It's not like I'm doing yoga on your lawn.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Go away, you're breaking my concentration.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hi Augustus, how's Melissa?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I think she'll have no problem getting into a good school. She's a smart girl.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Ah, my primary investor! Here, have a hot dog on the house!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Not sure when the next board meeting will be, but I'd like to tell you about a new menu item I'm thinking about.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Don't tell me what to do!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: You're not the boss of me!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hi Sir.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Want to play some poker, sir?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: I just dropped off a couple packages with James.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Did you order something from the himalayas? It had a lot of postage on it.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Don't mind me sir, just patrolling the street, keeping the neighborhood safe.
Mood_1.Phrase_2:
Last month I caught a suspicious individual around your house. 
Turns out he was just the sprinkler repairman, but you never know!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Arf!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: (tail wags)

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Sir, have you given any more thought to my scholarship proposal?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I'd really like to apply to grad school, but I'm not sure where I'll get the funds.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Get out of here, you filthy animal
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Oh, god, it pooped on me!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: What a lovely birdy.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Have another biscuit, sweetie.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Please don't poop on me bird.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Dang it bird, I said don't poop on me!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Coo
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Coooo

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Scram.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Damn birds pooping everywhere.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey birdy, if you go poop on that rich man I think we could be friends.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Way to go, bird. Now aim that poop at Mister Moneybags over there.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Watch out bird, Augustus likes to hunt pigeons like you.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: And if you poop on me again I'll send him your way!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Sorry bird, I don't have any bread for you.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Well you don't have to get all huffy about it.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey bird, see that lady doing yoga over there? Go get her.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: No, not me!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: You're disrupting my flow, bird.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I call this pose the Bird of Paradise. Your move.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hmm, maybe I can add a dove into my novel as a symbol of hope and renewal.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Or maybe I'll just leave birds out of it completely.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: No way bird, you're not getting these hot dog buns. Nice try.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Stop bird, get out of here!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Here biddy, biddy, biddy. Want some candy?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Candy's great, huh bird?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Scram.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Get out of here.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Morning, pigeon, sorry no mail for you today.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Bird, I said no mail, stopping trying to poop on me!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Look, I like you well enough, you pick up crumbs and you remind us all of nature in this urban jungle. But you have got to stop pooping on people.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: If you poop on me again I'll arrest you on charges of obstruction of justice.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: (Where's the rest of your flock?)
Mood_1.Phrase_2: (I know there were others before. Are they coming back?)

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Stop looking at me, bird.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I'm trying to study!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Sorry, paying customers only.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Maybe Augustus will buy you a coffee.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hello there, dearie. How has the winter been for you? I hope not too cold.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: If I ever find my husband's buried treasure, I'll make sure to give some to you. I want you to be happy!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey pal, how's it goin'?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: No offense, but if you want to get anywhere in this world, you're going to have to shower sometimes.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: (Rustles feathers)
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Coo

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Want this croissant? Came with my coffee, but I'm not going to eat it.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I usually get one of those everyday for being a loyal customer. Come back tomorrow, you can have my croissant then too.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: I've got a little freelance work for you if you're interested.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Not interested? I'm here if you change your mind.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Got something to say to Giovanni? Gonna have to wait your turn.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: We've got a little poker game going. Can't play without a buy-in. Maybe another time, huh?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: This is a beautiful little town, and there's nowhere better for a nap than under the old tree, but doesn't it feel like no one here even sees you?
Please don't get dirt on my suit.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Look here, if you can't help me with this shoe problem, I don't have anything to say to you.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: No job, huh? I know the feeling.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Here, take this frisbee. It's no good to me anymore.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Help me think of ways to annoy Mae and I'll buy you a sandwich.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Don't tell anyone I offered you that.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Care to join me?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I know this park is your home. Sorry if I'm getting in the way.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Dogs are such a comfort. Ever considered getting one?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Mind if I use you in my novel? I'm always looking for new perspectives to add to it.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: You're going to need a power suit if you want to get that job.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I might know some people who can help you out. I'll see what I can do.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: How's the love life, Joe?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Saw you at the ultimate frisbee game last week. You were pretty alright!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: You need to try harder, Joe! You have so much potential!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Come help me feed these birds, it'll take your mind off of that job interview.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: This lightbulb just won't work...
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I'm not sure you're tall enough to reach the lightbulb, Joe. But thanks for trying.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Brru
Mood_1.Phrase_2: (poop)

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Huh? Oh sorry, didn't see you there.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Want this coffee? I don't want it. It's lukewarm now - just like you!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Scram.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Get out of here.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey Joe.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: If you have time later, I might be up for a game of frisbee.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Sorry Joe, no work for you here.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Why not go back to school?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: You look familiar...
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Do I know you?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: You're an alright guy, Joe. Not sure I can say one way or the other if you're good or bad, but you're alright.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Nothing wrong with just meeting expectations.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Want to join me? Just stand on your head and touch your heels to your shoulders.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Yoga releases your inner strengths. You might find it useful!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: I've got a character like you in my book.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: You've got a great face. Very easy to describe.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: You should eat more hot dogs, they're good for you! Just an occasional hot dog isn't enough to get all the benefits!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I've got a new menu item in mind, maybe you'll be into it. But it's still in R&D, so I don't want to give the secret away!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Joe, got any candy?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Blech, I hate sugar free candy. Thanks for nothing.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Today I've got one bill, one letter, and one package for you. It's weird, they're all the same beige color.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Enjoy your mail!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Being a cop takes skill. It's a difficult job, but someone's got to do it.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Where are you working now?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Aaaaarf!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Bao!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Your face is fascinating. Can I draw you?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I'm actually studying astrophysics, but I think its important to have well rounded talents. I'm working on art now, but I'm not very good yet.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Good morning, Marjane! Have you seen Melissa? She's late for her Latin recital.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: With her mother gone, I just can't seem to talk with Melissa. I don't think she ever liked me.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Good morning! Green tea and a biscotti again?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I had a dream about a glass woman who played violin. If she played a high F, she'd shatter, so every song was a dance with death.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: When I was just a little girl, I played here with a boy named Teddy. I haven't thought of him in years, but he had a puppy just like yours.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: We buried a little treasure together one day. I don't remember where, but someone must have found it by now.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Mornin', ma'am. Sorry, I'll try and have this light functioning soon.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I always liked engineering. Little puzzles to solve in every machine. But this job is so tired - just one lightbulb after another.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Prooo?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Coo. Purururu. Broo burooo.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Mornin'! Care for a cup?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: My dad was like a monk. Ate nothing but rice and beans, never a drop of coffee or beer. Me, I can't function without a gallon of one or the other. There has to be a middle ground, huh?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: This is no place for a lovely lady like yourself.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Go on, the kids need you.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey teacher! We've got no school supplies here, sorry.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Take care of Mel for me, you hear?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: That's a sweet dog you've got there.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: See that little girl there, in the overalls? She reminds me of my daughter. Looks at me like I'm a monster, though.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Good morning. Don't tell anyone else, but I've lost the master's shoes in this tree, and I'm having a pickle of a time trying to get it out.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I just get so angry at Augustus sometimes. He doesn't deserve to be a father.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: 'Sup, babe.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Hey, want to write a story about me? I'll be Captain Hero and you can be the damsel in distress.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: No one wants to join me here. Come on, your ventricles could use some stretching.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I'm sure your stories are lovely. I don't know how to write, but I always feel drama in my limbs when I'm out here.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: I try not to forget that my story isn't the only one being written. All of my students, every fish and fly and fox, everyone has a story to tell. It seems like such a tragedy to ignore them.
What, a salad cart? You're nuts! Who would buy that?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Hot dogs are love! Hot dogs are life! Who would want to live without a hot dog in the morning and a chili dog at night?

Mood_!.Phrase_1: Mae looks serene and graceful, but I know it's all an act. If you really want to know a person, just try their muffins. Inner turmoil really comes out in the batter.
Mood_!.Phrase_2: Back in Canada, muffins are considered a delicacy. No one knows how to really enjoy a muffin out here.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hi, miss Marjane. No, I haven't done the homework yet.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Are you writing about me in your book? Can you write about me punching my dad in the nose?
We aren't supposed to talk to you. Boss says you'll make us spill the beans.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Morning! Sorry, nothing from the editor today.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I reread your story last night. I love the bit about the lighthouse. I always wanted to live in a lighthouse.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Oh, um, hi...
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I, uh, like your... dog.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: *Pant pant pant*
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Foof!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: What are you writing about? Does it have aliens?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I don't see the point of stories that don't have space travel. Or at least dragons.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: There you are! Come along, now. You're late for your Latin recital.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Look, don't you want to graduate magna cum laude from Yale, just like your daddy?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Melissa! Tall glass of whipped cream today, too?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I'm a little scared to see what you're like after an espresso.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hello again, dearie. Would you like a biscuit too?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Pigeons or people, everybody loves biscuits.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Go on, kid, I'm busy.
Broo?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Bawk!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Take it from me, kid. Don't start with this stuff. It'll consume your life.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: One mocha latte and I was hooked forever. I mean it, stick to herbal tea.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Madame Melissa! Care to join us?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: We'll start with a buy-in of fifteen jawbreakers and take it from there.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Yo, Mel. Keepin' Pops on his toes?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Come by when you're 16. I'll teach you to use a tommy gun.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey there, little lady.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: It's okay, I won't bite.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Good morning, mistress. Your father's not with you, is he?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Please give him the benefit of the doubt. He does care about you.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: What're you lookin' at? Is there something in my hair?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Creep kid, staring like that...

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Shush, I'm transcending my mortal trappings.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Just... inches... from... enlightenment...

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hello, Melissa. Are you getting along with your father today?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Don't forget your journal tomorrow, okay? You'll appreciate it when you're older.

Mood_!.Phrase_1: Hey, kid! Can you do me a favor? My friend Mae borrowed my muffin tin. She's busy doing her yoga, so can you run and get it for me?
Mood_!.Phrase_2: Of course it's my muffin tin! Just don't tell Mae about it. She, uh, needs her concentration.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey, no more for you. I'm not cleaning ketchup off your dad's car again.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Don't know how you pinned it on me in the first place...

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Grownups are all mushy, lonely, awkward losers.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Everyone wants company because nobody likes them.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey, Mel.
Your propeller hat's coming. Give it another six to eight weeks.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: No more water balloons in the mailbox, okay?

Mood_1.Phrase_1:
Psst... Hey! Melissa, right? Your daddy's a big man around town. 
You'll be just like him when you grow up, I can tell.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Can you do me a favor? Bring this over to the nice lady with the long hair. But no peeking!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: *Slurp*
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Groo!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Do you want to be an astronaut when you grow up? You must. Everyone wants to.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I'm going to be one for real, though.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Keep an eye out Phil. Someone stole my shoes this morning, haven't found the culprit yet.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: You ever seen that show 'Cops'? You remind me of those guys sometimes. Not sure why.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Keep up the good work, Phil.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Want some donuts? On the house.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: You remind me of your father. He was always so willing to help others.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: You're a sweetie, Phil. You act tough, but I know you're a sweetie.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Phil, my man, how are you?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: You and me, we're in the same boat. You're catching criminals, I'm fixing lightbulbs. But when you boil it down we're doing the same thing.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: BrrrCoo
Mood_1.Phrase_2: (poop)

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey, any chance you can get this parking ticket taken care of?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: No worries, just thought I'd ask.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Nothing fishy happening over here boss.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Just a couple of law abiding citizens not loitering on the sidewalk.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Can we help you?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: No, haven't seen anything suspicious around here.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey, thanks for the blanket last week, that was real nice of you.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: If you need any help let me know. I've got the scoop on just about everybody around here.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Good Morning sir, how are you today?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Really appreciate the work you do old chap.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey Phil, how's the wife?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Want to play some frisbee later? What time are you off duty?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: What has that Mae been telling you? I don't know why she has it out for me.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Of course I've never stolen anything! Why would you ask me that?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Can you please help me with Martha? She's driving me crazy.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: There's something her that just irks me. And yet I still have brunch with her on Sundays. Why do I do that to myself?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hi there.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Nice day, huh?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: You watch the game last week?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: If you've got some time later, let's hang out. I'll bring the hot dogs, you bring the beer.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: No officer, I'm not a truant, I have a note from my doctor saying that I can't go to school anymore.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: The doctor also said I have low blood sugar. Best way to cure it is to eat candy.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Evening Officer.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Just a couple of fellas hanging out, nothing to see here.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: I think someone's been tampering with the mail. Do you know how I can report that?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I think I've got a plan to get past that scary dog. I'm still working up the courage to try it out though.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: This is my beat, no need for two officers here.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: You new? Don't think I've seen you around before.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Bao!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Bark!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: You ever thought about becoming an astronaut?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Once we get to long distance space travel, we're going to need peace keepers like you. You've got the right stuff for space Phil.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Where did this dog come from?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Why is this dog on my lawn?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Well hello there little pup!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Don't you just have the sweetest face. Your eyes are almost human!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Careful dog, don't touch any of my tools there.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Nice doggy.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey, how's it goin'?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: You enjoy being a dog? Pigeon life is pretty alright.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: How did you get in here?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: You can't be in the cafe! Dogs aren't allowed!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Heh, look the dog wants to play poker.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Scram.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Shoo.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Damn dog.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey there Russell. Good to see you.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Thanks for cheering me up. Nice to know I have a friend.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Can you get up there? No I don't suppose you can without wings, eh?
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Here pup, have a treat. Good dog.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Let's play frisbee! I bet you'll love it!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Not a fan of frisbee after all, eh?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: What are you up to, dog? I don't like that sneaky look on your face.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Don't think you're going to get any treats from me.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Bet your favorite pose is downward facing dog!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Get it? Downward facing…because you're a dog. See?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey there Russell! You're the sweetest dog in the world!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: I'm so glad I have you around.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Uhh…nice doggy…don't, don't come any closer...
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Stay dog. Don't come over here!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: What a cute dog! Such a cutie! Hi dog!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Awww you have the fuzziest little ears!

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Shoo.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Don't want any dogs around here. No good looking at me with those puppy eyes.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Go away! I am not dinner!
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Why do you look so hungry all of the sudden?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: We could use a dog like you on the force. You've got a good sniffer.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Here, have a treat. Now go back and find your human.

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Hey, FYI I peed there. Don't pee over there too.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Want to sniff each others butts?

Mood_1.Phrase_1: Don't have time for dogs, I have a final next week.
Mood_1.Phrase_2: Are you still here? I have stuff to do!
